N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 §§ 1728-2.1 - Books and records

State Regulations
(a) Each housing
company shall keep its books and records in accordance with a chart of accounts
as prescribed by the division, except those projects whose mortgages are
federally insured by the Federal Housing Administration. Where mortgages are so
insured, the books and records shall be kept in accordance with those
requirements. (b) Each housing
company shall retain an independent certified public accountant. However, no
accountant shall be engaged without prior written approval of the division. The
request for approval shall state the audit procedure to be followed, the period
of the engagement (ordinarily not more than one year) and the fee to be
charged. Notes
